title: Nature & Animals
description: Explore the wonders of the natural world with questions about animals, plants, and ecosystems.

questions.question: What is the largest animal on Earth?
questions.explanation: The blue whale is the largest animal ever known to have existed on Earth, reaching lengths of up to 100 feet and weighing as much as 200 tons.

questions.question: What do you call a group of lions?
questions.explanation: A group of lions is called a pride. A typical pride consists of about 15 lions, including several related females, their cubs, and a small number of males.

questions.question: Which bird is known for its ability to mimic human speech?
questions.explanation: Parrots can mimic human speech because of their thick tongues and specialized vocal anatomy. African Grey parrots are considered the most talented talkers.

questions.question: What is the process by which plants make their own food using sunlight?
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis allows plants to convert sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide into glucose and oxygen. This process is essential for life on Earth.

questions.question: How many legs does a spider have?
questions.explanation: All spiders have eight legs. This distinguishes them from insects, which have six legs. Spiders belong to a group called arachnids.

questions.question: Which animal is known for carrying its babies in a pouch?
questions.explanation: Both koalas and kangaroos are marsupials and carry their young in pouches. Other marsupials include wombats, opossums, and wallabies.

questions.question: What is the tallest type of tree in the world?
questions.explanation: Coast redwoods (Sequoia sempervirens) are the tallest trees on Earth. The tallest known redwood, named Hyperion, stands over 380 feet tall in Northern California.

questions.question: Which ocean is the largest by area?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean, covering more than 60 million square miles. It is larger than all the land area on Earth combined.

questions.question: What type of animal is a monarch known for its long migration?
questions.explanation: Monarch butterflies make an incredible annual migration of up to 3,000 miles from the United States and Canada to central Mexico each fall.

questions.question: Which animal has the longest lifespan of any mammal?
questions.explanation: Bowhead whales can live over 200 years, making them the longest-lived mammals. Note that the Galapagos tortoise is a reptile, not a mammal, and can also live over 100 years.

questions.question: What is the only continent where penguins live naturally in the wild?
questions.explanation: Penguins are found naturally in the Southern Hemisphere, including Antarctica, South America, South Africa, New Zealand, and the Galapagos Islands -- but never in the Arctic.

questions.question: Which of these animals is a marsupial?
questions.explanation: The Virginia opossum is the only marsupial found in North America. Female opossums carry and nurse their young in a pouch, just like kangaroos.

questions.question: What is the largest species of bear?
questions.explanation: Polar bears are the largest species of bear, with adult males weighing up to 1,500 pounds. They are also the largest land carnivores on Earth.

questions.question: What gas do trees and plants absorb from the atmosphere?
questions.explanation: Trees absorb carbon dioxide during photosynthesis and release oxygen. A single mature tree can absorb about 48 pounds of carbon dioxide per year.

questions.question: Which sea creature has three hearts?
questions.explanation: An octopus has three hearts: two pump blood to the gills, and one pumps blood to the rest of the body. Their blood is also blue because it contains copper.
